intro: Riparoampelos, commonly known as the rock ivy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found growing on cliffs or in crevices. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Riparoampelos is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to colonize difficult terrain.
